newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Bank of Korea to absorb 900 bln won through repos.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Korea to absorb 900 bln won through repos.

text.p: The Bank of Korea said on Thursday it had decided to absorb 900 billion won from commercial banks through five-day repurchase agreements (repos).
"We have decided to soak up 900 billion won through five-day repos to deal with excess liquidity," a central bank official said.
He said the central bank's effort to mop up liquidity for the third day in row could tighten won reserves at local banks.
The central bank planned to invite tenders at 0630 GMT to sell the repos. --Seoul Newsroom (822) 727 5643
